type_map.name: type_map
type_map.doc: A list of strings. Give the name to each type of atoms. It is noted that the number of atom type of training system must be less than 128 in a GPU environment.

data_stat_nbatch.name: data_stat_nbatch
data_stat_nbatch.doc: The model determines the normalization from the statistics of the data. This key specifies the number of `frames` in each `system` used for statistics.

data_stat_protect.name: data_stat_protect
data_stat_protect.doc: Protect parameter for atomic energy regression.

use_srtab.name: use_srtab
use_srtab.doc: The table for the short-range pairwise interaction added on top of DP. The table is a text data file with (N_t + 1) * N_t / 2 + 1 columes. The first colume is the distance between atoms. The second to the last columes are energies for pairs of certain types. For example we have two atom types, 0 and 1. The columes from 2nd to 4th are for 0-0, 0-1 and 1-1 correspondingly.

smin_alpha.name: smin_alpha
smin_alpha.doc: The short-range tabulated interaction will be swithed according to the distance of the nearest neighbor. This distance is calculated by softmin. This parameter is the decaying parameter in the softmin. It is only required when `use_srtab` is provided.

sw_rmin.name: sw_rmin
sw_rmin.doc: The lower boundary of the interpolation between short-range tabulated interaction and DP. It is only required when `use_srtab` is provided.

sw_rmax.name: sw_rmax
sw_rmax.doc: The upper boundary of the interpolation between short-range tabulated interaction and DP. It is only required when `use_srtab` is provided.

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: Number of neurons in each hidden layers of the embedding net. When two layers are of the same size or one layer is twice as large as the previous layer, a skip connection is built.

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the embedding net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the embedding net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

trainable.name: trainable
trainable.doc: If the parameters in the embedding net are trainable

sel_a.name: sel_a
sel_a.doc: A list of integers. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel_a[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. The full relative coordinates of the neighbors are used by the descriptor.

sel_r.name: sel_r
sel_r.doc: A list of integers. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel_r[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. Only relative distance of the neighbors are used by the descriptor. sel_a[i] + sel_r[i] is recommended to be larger than the maximally possible number of type-i neighbors in the cut-off radius.

rcut.name: rcut
rcut.doc: The cut-off radius. The default value is 6.0

axis_rule.name: axis_rule
axis_rule.doc:
A list of integers. The length should be 6 times of the number of types. 

- axis_rule[i*6+0]: class of the atom defining the first axis of type-i atom. 0 for neighbors with full coordinates and 1 for neighbors only with relative distance.

- axis_rule[i*6+1]: type of the atom defining the first axis of type-i atom.

- axis_rule[i*6+2]: index of the axis atom defining the first axis. Note that the neighbors with the same class and type are sorted according to their relative distance.

- axis_rule[i*6+3]: class of the atom defining the first axis of type-i atom. 0 for neighbors with full coordinates and 1 for neighbors only with relative distance.

- axis_rule[i*6+4]: type of the atom defining the second axis of type-i atom.

- axis_rule[i*6+5]: class of the atom defining the second axis of type-i atom. 0 for neighbors with full coordinates and 1 for neighbors only with relative distance.

sel.name: sel
sel.doc:
This parameter set the number of selected neighbors for each type of atom. It can be:

    - `List[int]`. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. `sel[i]` is recommended to be larger than the maximally possible number of type-i neighbors in the cut-off radius. It is noted that the total sel value must be less than 4096 in a GPU environment.

    - `str`. Can be "auto:factor" or "auto". "factor" is a float number larger than 1. This option will automatically determine the `sel`. In detail it counts the maximal number of neighbors with in the cutoff radius for each type of neighbor, then multiply the maximum by the "factor". Finally the number is wraped up to 4 divisible. The option "auto" is equivalent to "auto:1.1".

rcut_smth.name: rcut_smth
rcut_smth.doc: Where to start smoothing. For example the 1/r term is smoothed from `rcut` to `rcut_smth`

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: Number of neurons in each hidden layers of the embedding net. When two layers are of the same size or one layer is twice as large as the previous layer, a skip connection is built.

axis_neuron.name: axis_neuron
axis_neuron.doc: Size of the submatrix of G (embedding matrix).

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the embedding net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

type_one_side.name: type_one_side
type_one_side.doc: Try to build N_types embedding nets. Otherwise, building N_types^2 embedding nets

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the embedding net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

trainable.name: trainable
trainable.doc: If the parameters in the embedding net is trainable

exclude_types.name: exclude_types
exclude_types.doc: The excluded pairs of types which have no interaction with each other. For example, `[[0, 1]]` means no interaction between type 0 and type 1.

set_davg_zero.name: set_davg_zero
set_davg_zero.doc: Set the normalization average to zero. This option should be set when `atom_ener` in the energy fitting is used

sel.name: sel
sel.doc:
This parameter set the number of selected neighbors for each type of atom. It can be:

    - `List[int]`. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. `sel[i]` is recommended to be larger than the maximally possible number of type-i neighbors in the cut-off radius. It is noted that the total sel value must be less than 4096 in a GPU environment.

    - `str`. Can be "auto:factor" or "auto". "factor" is a float number larger than 1. This option will automatically determine the `sel`. In detail it counts the maximal number of neighbors with in the cutoff radius for each type of neighbor, then multiply the maximum by the "factor". Finally the number is wraped up to 4 divisible. The option "auto" is equivalent to "auto:1.1".

rcut_smth.name: rcut_smth
rcut_smth.doc: Where to start smoothing. For example the 1/r term is smoothed from `rcut` to `rcut_smth`

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: Number of neurons in each hidden layers of the embedding net. When two layers are of the same size or one layer is twice as large as the previous layer, a skip connection is built.

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the embedding net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the embedding net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

trainable.name: trainable
trainable.doc: If the parameters in the embedding net are trainable

set_davg_zero.name: set_davg_zero
set_davg_zero.doc: Set the normalization average to zero. This option should be set when `atom_ener` in the energy fitting is used

sel.doc:
This parameter set the number of selected neighbors for each type of atom. It can be:

    - `List[int]`. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. `sel[i]` is recommended to be larger than the maximally possible number of type-i neighbors in the cut-off radius. In detail it counts the maximal number of neighbors with in the cutoff radius for each type of neighbor, then multiply the maximum by the "factor". Finally the number is wraped up to 4 divisible. The option "auto" is equivalent to "auto:1.1".

rcut_smth.name: rcut_smth
rcut_smth.doc: Where to start smoothing. For example the 1/r term is smoothed from `rcut` to `rcut_smth`

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: Number of neurons in each hidden layers of the embedding net. When two layers are of the same size or one layer is twice as large as the previous layer, a skip connection is built.

axis_neuron.name: axis_neuron
axis_neuron.doc: Size of the submatrix of G (embedding matrix).

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the embedding net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

type_one_side.name: type_one_side
type_one_side.doc: Try to build N_types embedding nets. Otherwise, building N_types^2 embedding nets

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the embedding net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

trainable.name: trainable
trainable.doc: If the parameters in the embedding net is trainable

exclude_types.name: exclude_types
exclude_types.doc: The excluded pairs of types which have no interaction with each other. For example, `[[0, 1]]` means no interaction between type 0 and type 1.

set_davg_zero.name: set_davg_zero
set_davg_zero.doc: Set the normalization average to zero. This option should be set when `atom_ener` in the energy fitting is used

type_nchanl.name: type_nchanl
type_nchanl.doc: number of channels for type embedding

type_nlayer.name: type_nlayer
type_nlayer.doc: number of hidden layers of type embedding net

numb_aparam.name: numb_aparam
numb_aparam.doc: dimension of atomic parameter. if set to a value > 0, the atomic parameters are embedded.

sel.name: sel
sel.doc:
This parameter set the number of selected neighbors for each type of atom. It can be:

    - `List[int]`. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. `sel[i]` is recommended to be larger than the maximally possible number of type-i neighbors in the cut-off radius. It is noted that the total sel value must be less than 4096 in a GPU environment.

    - `str`. Can be "auto:factor" or "auto". "factor" is a float number larger than 1. This option will automatically determine the `sel`. In detail it counts the maximal number of neighbors with in the cutoff radius for each type of neighbor, then multiply the maximum by the "factor". Finally the number is wraped up to 4 divisible. The option "auto" is equivalent to "auto:1.1".

rcut_smth.name: rcut_smth
rcut_smth.doc: Where to start smoothing. For example the 1/r term is smoothed from `rcut` to `rcut_smth`

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: Number of neurons in each hidden layers of the embedding net. When two layers are of the same size or one layer is twice as large as the previous layer, a skip connection is built.

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the embedding net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

type_one_side.name: type_one_side
type_one_side.doc: Try to build N_types embedding nets. Otherwise, building N_types^2 embedding nets

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the embedding net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

trainable.name: trainable
trainable.doc: If the parameters in the embedding net are trainable

exclude_types.name: exclude_types
exclude_types.doc: The excluded pairs of types which have no interaction with each other. For example, `[[0, 1]]` means no interaction between type 0 and type 1.

set_davg_zero.name: set_davg_zero
set_davg_zero.doc: Set the normalization average to zero. This option should be set when `atom_ener` in the energy fitting is used

sel.name: sel
sel.doc: A list of integers. The length of the list should be the same as the number of atom types in the system. `sel[i]` gives the selected number of type-i neighbors. The full relative coordinates of the neighbors are used by the descriptor.

rcut.name: rcut
rcut.doc: The cut-off radius. The default value is 6.0

gr.name: gr
gr.doc: lists of parameters of :math:`G^R`, should have `rs`, `eta` keys

ga.name: ga
ga.doc: lists of parameters of :math:`G^A`, should have `zeta`, `thetas`, `eta`, `rs` keys

type.doc:
The type of the descritpor. See explanation below. 

- `loc_frame`: Defines a local frame at each atom, and the compute the descriptor as local coordinates under this frame.

- `se_e2_a`: Used by the smooth edition of Deep Potential. The full relative coordinates are used to construct the descriptor.

- `se_e2_r`: Used by the smooth edition of Deep Potential. Only the distance between atoms is used to construct the descriptor.

- `se_e3`: Used by the smooth edition of Deep Potential. The full relative coordinates are used to construct the descriptor. Three-body embedding will be used by this descriptor.

- `se_a_tpe`: Used by the smooth edition of Deep Potential. The full relative coordinates are used to construct the descriptor. Type embedding will be used by this descriptor.

- `hybrid`: Concatenate of a list of descriptors as a new descriptor.

numb_fparam.name: numb_fparam
numb_fparam.doc: The dimension of the frame parameter. If set to >0, file `fparam.npy` should be included to provided the input fparams.

numb_aparam.name: numb_aparam
numb_aparam.doc: The dimension of the atomic parameter. If set to >0, file `aparam.npy` should be included to provided the input aparams.

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: The number of neurons in each hidden layers of the fitting net. When two hidden layers are of the same size, a skip connection is built.

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the fitting net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the fitting net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

trainable.name: trainable
trainable.doc:
Whether the parameters in the fitting net are trainable. This option can be

- bool: True if all parameters of the fitting net are trainable, False otherwise.

- list of bool: Specifies if each layer is trainable. Since the fitting net is composed by hidden layers followed by a output layer, the length of tihs list should be equal to len(`neuron`)+1.

rcond.name: rcond
rcond.doc: The condition number used to determine the inital energy shift for each type of atoms.

seed.name: seed
seed.doc: Random seed for parameter initialization of the fitting net

atom_ener.name: atom_ener
atom_ener.doc: Specify the atomic energy in vacuum for each type

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: The number of neurons in each hidden layers of the fitting net. When two hidden layers are of the same size, a skip connection is built.

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the fitting net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the fitting net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

sel_type.name: sel_type
sel_type.doc: The atom types for which the atomic dipole will be provided. If not set, all types will be selected.

seed.name: seed
seed.doc: Random seed for parameter initialization of the fitting net

neuron.name: neuron
neuron.doc: The number of neurons in each hidden layers of the fitting net. When two hidden layers are of the same size, a skip connection is built.

activation_function.name: activation_function
activation_function.doc: The activation function in the fitting net. Supported activation functions are "relu", "relu6", "softplus", "sigmoid", "tanh", "gelu".

resnet_dt.name: resnet_dt
resnet_dt.doc: Whether to use a "Timestep" in the skip connection

precision.name: precision
precision.doc: The precision of the fitting net parameters, supported options are "default", "float16", "float32", "float64".

fit_diag.name: fit_diag
fit_diag.doc: Fit the diagonal part of the rotational invariant polarizability matrix, which will be converted to normal polarizability matrix by contracting with the rotation matrix.

scale.name: scale
scale.doc: The output of the fitting net (polarizability matrix) will be scaled by ``scale``

shift_diag.name: shift_diag
shift_diag.doc: Whether to shift the diagonal of polar, which is beneficial to training. Default is true.

sel_type.name: sel_type
sel_type.doc: The atom types for which the atomic polarizability will be provided. If not set, all types will be selected.

seed.name: seed
seed.doc: Random seed for parameter initialization of the fitting net

type.doc:
The type of the fitting. See explanation below. 

- `ener`: Fit an energy model (potential energy surface).

- `dipole`: Fit an atomic dipole model. Global dipole labels or atomic dipole labels for all the selected atoms (see `sel_type`) should be provided by `dipole.npy` in each data system. The file either has number of frames lines and 3 times of number of selected atoms columns, or has number of frames lines and 3 columns. See `loss` parameter.

- `polar`: Fit an atomic polarizability model. Global polarizazbility labels or atomic polarizability labels for all the selected atoms (see `sel_type`) should be provided by `polarizability.npy` in each data system. The file eith has number of frames lines and 9 times of number of selected atoms columns, or has number of frames lines and 9 columns. See `loss` parameter.

model_name.name: model_name
model_name.doc: The name of the frozen dipole model file.

model_charge_map.name: model_charge_map
model_charge_map.doc: The charge of the WFCC. The list length should be the same as the `sel_type <model/fitting_net[dipole]/sel_type_>`_.

sys_charge_map.name: sys_charge_map
sys_charge_map.doc: The charge of real atoms. The list length should be the same as the `type_map <model/type_map_>`_

ewald_beta.name: ewald_beta
ewald_beta.doc: The splitting parameter of Ewald sum. Unit is A^-1

ewald_h.name: ewald_h
ewald_h.doc: The grid spacing of the FFT grid. Unit is A

type.doc:
The type of modifier. See explanation below.

-`dipole_charge`: Use WFCC to model the electronic structure of the system. Correct the long-range interaction

model_file.name: model_file
model_file.doc: The input model file, which will be compressed by the DeePMD-kit.

table_config.name: table_config
table_config.doc: The arguments of model compression, including extrapolate(scale of model extrapolation), stride(uniform stride of tabulation's first and second table), and frequency(frequency of tabulation overflow check).

min_nbor_dist.name: min_nbor_dist
min_nbor_dist.doc: The nearest distance between neighbor atoms saved in the frozen model.

type.doc: The type of model compression, which should be consistent with the descriptor type.

scale_by_worker.name: scale_by_worker
scale_by_worker.doc: When parallel training or batch size scaled, how to alter learning rate. Valid values are `linear`(default), `sqrt` or `none`.

start_lr.name: start_lr
start_lr.doc: The learning rate the start of the training.

stop_lr.name: stop_lr
stop_lr.doc: The desired learning rate at the end of the training.

decay_steps.name: decay_steps
decay_steps.doc: The learning rate is decaying every this number of training steps.

type.doc: The type of the learning rate.

name: loss
doc:
The definition of loss function. The loss type should be set to `tensor`, `ener` or left unset.
\.

start_pref_e.name: start_pref_e
start_pref_e.doc: The prefactor of energy loss at the start of the training. Should be larger than or equal to 0. If set to none-zero value, the energy label should be provided by file energy.npy in each data system. If both start_pref_energy and limit_pref_energy are set to 0, then the energy will be ignored.

limit_pref_e.name: limit_pref_e
limit_pref_e.doc: The prefactor of energy loss at the limit of the training, Should be larger than or equal to 0. i.e. the training step goes to infinity.

start_pref_f.name: start_pref_f
start_pref_f.doc: The prefactor of force loss at the start of the training. Should be larger than or equal to 0. If set to none-zero value, the force label should be provided by file force.npy in each data system. If both start_pref_force and limit_pref_force are set to 0, then the force will be ignored.

limit_pref_f.name: limit_pref_f
limit_pref_f.doc: The prefactor of force loss at the limit of the training, Should be larger than or equal to 0. i.e. the training step goes to infinity.

start_pref_v.name: start_pref_v
start_pref_v.doc: The prefactor of virial loss at the start of the training. Should be larger than or equal to 0. If set to none-zero value, the virial label should be provided by file virial.npy in each data system. If both start_pref_virial and limit_pref_virial are set to 0, then the virial will be ignored.

limit_pref_v.name: limit_pref_v
limit_pref_v.doc: The prefactor of virial loss at the limit of the training, Should be larger than or equal to 0. i.e. the training step goes to infinity.

start_pref_ae.name: start_pref_ae
start_pref_ae.doc: The prefactor of atom_ener loss at the start of the training. Should be larger than or equal to 0. If set to none-zero value, the atom_ener label should be provided by file atom_ener.npy in each data system. If both start_pref_atom_ener and limit_pref_atom_ener are set to 0, then the atom_ener will be ignored.

limit_pref_ae.name: limit_pref_ae
limit_pref_ae.doc: The prefactor of atom_ener loss at the limit of the training, Should be larger than or equal to 0. i.e. the training step goes to infinity.

start_pref_pf.name: start_pref_pf
start_pref_pf.doc: The prefactor of atom_pref loss at the start of the training. Should be larger than or equal to 0. If set to none-zero value, the atom_pref label should be provided by file atom_pref.npy in each data system. If both start_pref_atom_pref and limit_pref_atom_pref are set to 0, then the atom_pref will be ignored.

limit_pref_pf.name: limit_pref_pf
limit_pref_pf.doc: The prefactor of atom_pref loss at the limit of the training, Should be larger than or equal to 0. i.e. the training step goes to infinity.

relative_f.name: relative_f
relative_f.doc: If provided, relative force error will be used in the loss. The difference of force will be normalized by the magnitude of the force in the label with a shift given by `relative_f`, i.e. DF_i / ( || F || + relative_f ) with DF denoting the difference between prediction and label and || F || denoting the L2 norm of the label.

pref.name: pref
pref.doc: The prefactor of the weight of global loss. It should be larger than or equal to 0. If controls the weight of loss corresponding to global label, i.e. 'polarizability.npy` or `dipole.npy`, whose shape should be #frames x [9 or 3]. If it's larger than 0.0, this npy should be included.

pref_atomic.name: pref_atomic
pref_atomic.doc: The prefactor of the weight of atomic loss. It should be larger than or equal to 0. If controls the weight of loss corresponding to atomic label, i.e. `atomic_polarizability.npy` or `atomic_dipole.npy`, whose shape should be #frames x ([9 or 3] x #selected atoms). If it's larger than 0.0, this npy should be included. Both `pref` and `pref_atomic` should be provided, and either can be set to 0.0.

type.doc:
The type of the loss. When the fitting type is `ener`, the loss type should be set to `ener` or left unset. When the fitting type is `dipole` or `polar`, the loss type should be set to `tensor`. 
\.

systems.name: systems
systems.doc: The data systems for training. This key can be provided with a list that specifies the systems, or be provided with a string by which the prefix of all systems are given and the list of the systems is automatically generated.

set_prefix.name: set_prefix
set_prefix.doc: The prefix of the sets in the `systems <training/training_data/systems_>`_.

batch_size.name: batch_size
batch_size.doc:
This key can be 

- list: the length of which is the same as the `systems <training/training_data/systems_>`_. The batch size of each system is given by the elements of the list.

- int: all `systems <training/training_data/systems_>`_ use the same batch size.

- string "auto": automatically determines the batch size so that the batch_size times the number of atoms in the system is no less than 32.

- string "auto:N": automatically determines the batch size so that the batch_size times the number of atoms in the system is no less than N.

auto_prob.name: auto_prob
auto_prob.doc:
Determine the probability of systems automatically. The method is assigned by this key and can be

- "prob_uniform"  : the probability all the systems are equal, namely 1.0/self.get_nsystems()

- "prob_sys_size" : the probability of a system is proportional to the number of batches in the system

- "prob_sys_size;stt_idx:end_idx:weight;stt_idx:end_idx:weight;..." : the list of systems is devided into blocks. A block is specified by `stt_idx:end_idx:weight`, where `stt_idx` is the starting index of the system, `end_idx` is then ending (not including) index of the system, the probabilities of the systems in this block sums up to `weight`, and the relatively probabilities within this block is proportional to the number of batches in the system.

sys_probs.name: sys_probs
sys_probs.doc: A list of float if specified. Should be of the same length as `systems`, specifying the probability of each system.

validation_data.name: validation_data
validation_data.doc: Configurations of validation data. Similar to that of training data, except that a `numb_btch` argument may be configured

systems.name: systems
systems.doc: The data systems for validation. This key can be provided with a list that specifies the systems, or be provided with a string by which the prefix of all systems are given and the list of the systems is automatically generated.

set_prefix.name: set_prefix
set_prefix.doc: The prefix of the sets in the `systems <training/validation_data/systems_>`_.

batch_size.name: batch_size
batch_size.doc:
This key can be 

- list: the length of which is the same as the `systems <training/validation_data/systems_>`_. The batch size of each system is given by the elements of the list.

- int: all `systems <training/validation_data/systems_>`_ use the same batch size.

- string "auto": automatically determines the batch size so that the batch_size times the number of atoms in the system is no less than 32.

- string "auto:N": automatically determines the batch size so that the batch_size times the number of atoms in the system is no less than N.

auto_prob.name: auto_prob
auto_prob.doc:
Determine the probability of systems automatically. The method is assigned by this key and can be

- "prob_uniform"  : the probability all the systems are equal, namely 1.0/self.get_nsystems()

- "prob_sys_size" : the probability of a system is proportional to the number of batches in the system

- "prob_sys_size;stt_idx:end_idx:weight;stt_idx:end_idx:weight;..." : the list of systems is devided into blocks. A block is specified by `stt_idx:end_idx:weight`, where `stt_idx` is the starting index of the system, `end_idx` is then ending (not including) index of the system, the probabilities of the systems in this block sums up to `weight`, and the relatively probabilities within this block is proportional to the number of batches in the system.

sys_probs.name: sys_probs
sys_probs.doc: A list of float if specified. Should be of the same length as `systems`, specifying the probability of each system.

numb_btch.name: numb_btch
numb_btch.doc: An integer that specifies the number of systems to be sampled for each validation period.

numb_steps.name: numb_steps
numb_steps.doc: Number of training batch. Each training uses one batch of data.

seed.name: seed
seed.doc: The random seed for getting frames from the training data set.

disp_file.name: disp_file
disp_file.doc: The file for printing learning curve.

disp_freq.name: disp_freq
disp_freq.doc: The frequency of printing learning curve.

save_freq.name: save_freq
save_freq.doc: The frequency of saving check point.

save_ckpt.name: save_ckpt
save_ckpt.doc: The file name of saving check point.

tensorboard_log_dir.name: tensorboard_log_dir
tensorboard_log_dir.doc: The log directory of tensorboard outputs

tensorboard_freq.name: tensorboard_freq
tensorboard_freq.doc: The frequency of writing tensorboard events.
